[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Disputes Management System (DMS) defines requirements for compliance, usability, security, and performance in managing dispute cases.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: DMS provides a secure dispute resolution platform for cardmember and merchant services, ensuring compliance with corporate and regulatory standards.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: DMS integrates with Statement, Cardmember, and Merchant databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: DMS supports a responsive UI following corporate UI standards.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: DMS is compatible with enterprise desktops and web environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: DMS uses RESTful APIs for case processing and database interactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: DMS ensures secure HTTPS/TLS 1.3 data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: DMS is optimized for high transaction volumes.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: DMS operates 24x7 with scheduled maintenance windows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: DMS supports multilingual and accessibility features.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: DMS links to corporate compliance and regulatory systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: DMS facilitates dispute case creation, tracking, resolution, and regulatory compliance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: DMS is designed for cardmember and merchant services representatives handling dispute cases.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: DMS requires corporate network access and authentication.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: DMS depends on corporate databases and external regulatory compliance services.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Dispute Case: Transaction dispute requiring resolution.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Statement, Cardmember, and Merchant databases to retrieve transaction and customer details.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect to the Letters application for dispute-related communications.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow authorized users to create and track dispute cases via the UI.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support search functionality by dispute case number, merchant, or cardholder details (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enable authorized users to initiate ticket retrieval requests for dispute resolution (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall comply with corporate UI standards for consistency and accessibility.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall color-code dispute case statuses for visual clarity and efficiency.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall load screens promptly under standard operating conditions.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 350 concurrent users without performance degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall maintain a complete case history, logging all modifications with timestamps.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall conform to corporate legal and regulatory standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall maintain an audit trail of dispute modifications.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall follow corporate regulatory guidelines and comply with PCI DSS.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain nearly always uptime outside scheduled maintenance windows.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests dispute creation, search functionality, UI performance, and security compliance.
[SEC] 5. References: UI guidelines, PCI DSS, Regulation E, Z.
